Class Board

java.lang.Object
Board
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener
public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
This class creates the board of the game c and implements it's mechanics.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Board()
    This is the constructor that creates a JFrame where are added the 4x4 board and the directional arrows.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void actionPerformed​(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
    Check what button is pressed and perform different actions.
    void addHolesToBoard()
    This method creates and array of Holes.
    void addObstacles()
    Add the squirrels/flowers/holes to the board on their location on the matrix of squares
    void changeSquirrelHead()
    Change the head of a squirrel from a nutHead to a simple head and decrement the the nutHead counter.
    void checkHole()
    Check when a nutHead is above a hole and change the picture of the hole to a holeNut.
    void checkWin()
    Check when a level is won and display an appropriate message.
    void doFullMovementCycle()
    Complete the movement of a squirrel.
    void moveThreeTileSquirrel​(java.lang.String direction)
    Change the 3 tile squirrel coordinates in relation with the choosen direction
    void ResetBoard()
    Set the icons of the board buttons to empty squares and make them available for movement.
    void selectionTab()
    This method creates a new JFrame from which the player is able to select the levels and see the number of moves he/she has done.
    void selectLevel​(java.lang.String selectedLevel)
    This method sets the postions of squirrels and flowers on the board.
    void setPreviousSquaresAvailable()
    After every move, the previous squares that were a squirrel have to be set available, so that another squirrel can move to those coordinates.
    boolean validMove​(Squirrel clickedSquirrel, java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
    Check if the movement of the squirrel the player chooses is valid.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      This is the constructor that creates a JFrame where are added the 4x4 board and the directional arrows.

  • Method Details

    • selectionTab

      public void selectionTab()
      This method creates a new JFrame from which the player is able to select the levels and see the number of moves he/she has done.

    • addHolesToBoard

      public void addHolesToBoard()
      This method creates and array of Holes. Each hole object has a picture, position x and y in the board matrix and type (hole or nutHole)

    • selectLevel

      public void selectLevel​(java.lang.String selectedLevel)
      This method sets the postions of squirrels and flowers on the board. The positions, rotations and colour of the squirrels are different for every level.
      Parameters:
      selectedLevel - the level selected determins the positions.

    • addObstacles

      public void addObstacles()
      Add the squirrels/flowers/holes to the board on their location on the matrix of squares

    • ResetBoard

      public void ResetBoard()
      Set the icons of the board buttons to empty squares and make them available for movement.

    • changeSquirrelHead

      public void changeSquirrelHead()
      Change the head of a squirrel from a nutHead to a simple head and decrement the the nutHead counter.

    • checkHole

      public void checkHole()
      Check when a nutHead is above a hole and change the picture of the hole to a holeNut.

    • validMove

      public boolean validMove​(Squirrel clickedSquirrel, java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      Check if the movement of the squirrel the player chooses is valid.
      Parameters:
      clickedSquirrel - the choosen squirrel.
      e - the direction up/down/left/right.
      rotation - the rotation of the pictures in degrees of the respective squirrel.
      Returns:
      true if valid/false if not.

    • setPreviousSquaresAvailable

      public void setPreviousSquaresAvailable()
      After every move, the previous squares that were a squirrel have to be set available, so that another squirrel can move to those coordinates.

    • checkWin

      public void checkWin()
      Check when a level is won and display an appropriate message.

    • moveThreeTileSquirrel

      public void moveThreeTileSquirrel​(java.lang.String direction)
      Change the 3 tile squirrel coordinates in relation with the choosen direction
      Parameters:
      direction - a string that represents the direction (up/down/left/right).

    • doFullMovementCycle

      public void doFullMovementCycle()
      Complete the movement of a squirrel. 1. Change the prev squares where the squirrel was with the respective board tile. 2. Check for headNuts over normal holes. 3. Add the obstacoles to the board. 4. Increment move counter and set new value on button.

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed​(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      Check what button is pressed and perform different actions.
      Specified by:
      actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
